the suggestion of bankruptcy protection. California Treasurer Bill Lockyer told Reuters Insider Monday that states may not need the same freedom to declare bankruptcy as major companies because they have a guaranteed source of revenue. The major difference, of course, is that we're looking at sovereign governments that have the ability to enact a tax, and that's not the case of these private corporations that may have unfunded obligations that they can't deal with, he said.
